title: Message list pane not showing messages
content:
Hi, I have Thunderbird 115 on a Linux Manjaro installation with several email accounts. Everything worked just fine until my last working day. I came back today, Manjaro did a general update including Thunderbird (to 115.2.0-3) and now I have an issue with it. The "message list pane" is not showing any messages in neither account. Synchonisation is fine. The number of read/unread messages in the folder pane changes automatically when I do something in the webmail (e.g., Gmail). In addition, I can search for any messages in the general search, including the ones just sent/received. (But if I search for messages, I get the message "msgWindow.domWindow.gMessageDisplay is undefined" in the status bar.) Filter is not working though. I have already checked if I have accidentally selected any filter feature that conceals all messages. It doesn't seem to be the case. I have also checked in the Manjaro forum and it doesn't look anyone has had issues with it, so it doesn't seem to be a global problem.

Could anyone help me in this? Thanks!
creator: talestomaz

title: How to Convert Email and Attachments From Thunderbird to PST?
content:
How to Convert Email and Attachments From Thunderbird to PST?

Freely manually convert Thunderbird email and attachments to PST. Make sure you properly follow these instructions so that users can follow them. Because many users are unable to master technological techniques. The manual method takes a lot of time. In this procedure, users risk losing their data. But even if you carefully follow these instructions, you might still lose all of your data if you forget one step. Data loss does not equal recovery.

Manual Method: Export Emails from Thunderbird to EML

  • On your PC, launch Thunderbird.
  • Choose the folder, such as your Inbox or Sent folder, from which you wish to export emails.
  • To pick an email for export, click on it.
  • Go to the "File" menu and choose "Save As."
  • Make sure to pick "EML" as the "File type" in the store As dialogue box when choosing a place on your computer to store the email to.
  • Press "Save." For each email you want to export, repeat those steps.
  • To convert all of your emails to PST, repeat this process.

This process is very long and time tekan. I used multiple applications and explored through Google looking for the issue, but just one tool was able to resolve it. I recommend using Thunderbird to PST Converter for Mac Software. This application converts one and bulk Thunderbird Mailbox files to PST file format.

https://devfolio.co/projects/mailvita-thunderbird-to-pst-converter-for-mac-8b6b https://www.mailvita.com/blog/accurately-transfer-thunderbird-emails-and-attachments-in-outlook-pst/

Here are the steps for converting emails and attachments from Thunderbird to PST: -

  1. Download and install Mailvita Thunderbird to PST Converter Software on your PC.
  2. Launch the software select the Load Default Location and Enter Manually.
  3. Enter the Thunderbird Location and Click on the Search the list of MBOX files from the Thunderbird Button.
  4. Show the preview of the MBOX file
  5. Choose the Output Option:- Single and Multiple Thunderbird Files
  6. Click the Browse Button and Select the destination path where you want to save the PST file.
  7. Click on the "Convert" button to start the conversion process.

https://www.mailvita.com/thunderbird-to-pst-converter-for-mac/ https://www.trickyenough.com/thunderbird-mailbox-converter-export-thunderbird-attachments-to-pst/

title: Cannot delete mail immediately - new Thunderbird & Gmail
content:
Hello,

I was using the previous version of Thunderbird without any issue with Gmail and IMAP.

I have set up my accounts so that when I delete a mail in thunderbird, it gets automatically and completely removed from the server (not even stored in Trash server folder), after getting a confirmation popup (done via an extension). I choose the corresponding option in the account settings page.

With the latest version however: When I select the option to delete the mail immediately from the server in the account settings, The mail is only marked as read in web Gmail and not deleted. When I select the option "Move to trash folder" the mail is correctly sent to Trash on Thunderbird AND the server but I don't want to have to empty trash manually.

What can I do to reproduce the old behavior?
creator: leraleur

title: Thunderbird,POP,Gmail - emails in linked thunderbird inbox, but not showing up in gmail
content:
So, I'm helping my mom out with transferring emails from one gmail account to another.

I'm successfully able to import the .mbox files from the googletakeouts folder into the thunderbird account that is linked to her gmail through Pop, (not IMAP), using an older version of thunderbird (102.9.1) [since the new version you can't import .mbox files - kind of a deal breaker if you're trying to do massive email migrations because google has decided that .mbox files is the cleanest way to do it, but boy am i so grateful this actually worked].

On thunderbird I see all ~112,000 emails all nice and pretty in the local files. So I then in select all and move all the emails into [Inbox]- bam no problems...but now when I go into the gmail account in the chrome browser I don't see them. IMAP and POP are enabled on the account, they're also not in the [All mail] folder. They just aren't there. I've quit thunderbird and restarted, and did the same to the gmail account. Switched the SMTP port for thunderbird from 465 to 587. Nothing

TLDR - I can pull the emails up in thunderbird no problem. But i don't see them in the gmail inbox. Do I change server type from POP/local storage to IMAP? what's the fix boss

much appreciated!
creator: samuel.srajer

title: Incoming email missing the body.
content: Every once in a while a complete series of incoming emails has nothing in the body. I click any recent 'good' email. Perhaps the subject is "XYZ". Clicking any of the 'bad' emails will show the good email's From, To, and subject of "XYZ". It seems to last for, maybe 20 incoming emails, then the issue stops. It has happened several times over the last year. If I go out to Xfinity the same emails do not have this issue. How do I fix this?
creator: JimJamie

title: Cannot send email after upgrade from TB 102.15 to 115.2
content: I have 2 mail accounts synced to TB. Both are hotmail accounts. I can send emails from 1 but not the other after updating TB from 102.15 to 115.2. Everything else seems to work. I've changed no settings and they seem correct as far as I can tell. When I try to send mail from the problem account, a blank browser pop-up comes for a few seconds (authentication?) then disappears; then, the "sending" bubble comes up and then times out giving this error message: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again." What is a solution for this? Thanks in advance.
creator: natehathaway
